intro: Campanula ovacikensis subsp. ovacikensis, commonly known as the Ovacık bellflower, is a rare and endemic species native to Turkey. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils in alpine or subalpine regions. It has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
